title: Why do musicians still sell vinyl records? - Quora

response.answer_text: There’s as belief among some audiophiles and musicians that vinyl sounds better. When you put a needle on vinyl, you feel you’re part of a tradition, reaching back to the earliest days of recorded music (a bit like a brit milah). Vinyl records are collectible (my nephew tells me his friends buy vinyl records as collectibles - they don’t play them.) Also, there’s still a market for new vinyl records.

Vinyl pressed today sound better than those pressed in the 60s. This is because the original recordings are now digital rather than lower-quality tape masters. The recording equipment used today is far more advanced as well. There’s a belief among some audiophiles and musicians that vinyl sounds better.
